testID-001.title: Presence of visually unlabeled fields
testID-001.detail: All form elements must have a visible label.
testID-001.solution: Provide a relevant label, visible near each form field.

testID-004.title: Absence of data format
testID-004.detail: A data format is necessary to allow all users to correctly enter information.
testID-004.solution: Add a data format. This format is programmatically linked to the field.
testID-004.technicalSolution:
Apply one of the solutions below: - integrate the data format into the label element example: - link the format to the field via an aria-describedby attribute example:

Input format: DD/MM/YYYY

testID-072.title: Presence of fields not linked to the label
testID-072.detail: All label tags must be linked to the corresponding field.
testID-072.solution: The label tag must have a for attribute pointing to the id of the corresponding input.

testID-072.title: Presence of unlabeled fields
testID-072.detail: All form elements must have an accessible name.
testID-072.solution:
Apply one of the solutions below:
- add a "label" element, hidden if necessary, programmatically linked to the field
- use an aria-labelledby pointing to relevant information to understand the nature of the field
- add an aria-label attribute
- add a title attribute
testID-072.technicalSolution:
Examples: - -

[…]

- -

testID-072.title: The data format is not programmatically linked to the field
testID-072.detail: The data format will not be perceived from assistive technology (e.g., screen reader) when there is no explicit link to the field.
testID-072.solution: Add a data format. This format is programmatically linked to the field.
testID-072.technicalSolution:
Apply one of the solutions below: - integrate the data format into the label element example: - link the format to the field via an aria-describedby attribute example:

Input format: DD/MM/YYYY

testID-071.title: Presence of irrelevant field labels
testID-071.detail: All form elements must have a relevant label that helps understand the nature of the field.
testID-071.solution: Complete the text label of the label to understand the function of the field and/or the expected data.

testID-002.title: Presence of ungrouped fields
testID-002.detail: When necessary, fields of the same nature must be grouped.
testID-002.solution:
- apply a "fieldset" completed by a "legend" element
- apply a "group" role on the parent element encapsulating the fields, and complete with an equivalent legend based on aria-labelledby

testID-003.title: Mandatory field not visually identifiable
testID-003.detail: The visual identification of the mandatory field does not rely solely on color.
testID-003.solution: Add visual information that does not rely solely on color, e.g., an asterisk, icon…

testID-003.title: Mandatory field not programmatically identifiable
testID-003.detail: The identification of a mandatory field is not possible from assistive technology (e.g., screen reader) if it is not provided programmatically.
testID-003.solution:
Use one of the techniques below:
- visual information integrated into the label
- add a "required" attribute on the input
- add an "aria-required" attribute on the input

testID-005.title: Absence of autocomplete attribute for fields collecting personal data
testID-005.detail: Any field that collects specific data about the user must have an "autocomplete" attribute.
testID-005.solution: Add an "autocomplete" attribute to the input. The value of the autocomplete depends on the nature of the information collected in the field.

testID-006.title: Error messages are not perceived by users
testID-006.detail: Error messages must be perceived by all users, regardless of their equipment.
testID-006.solution:
Apply one of the techniques below:
- The error message is present before the form.
 The message lists the fields with errors.
- The focus is placed on the error message.
- Anchors allow the user to position themselves on the fields with errors.
- Error messages are added in the labels of the fields.
- Error messages are not integrated into the labels, but a mechanism is present to link the fields and errors programmatically: see ```aria-describedby``` or ```aria-labelledby```.

testID-006.title: Fields with errors are not perceived by users
testID-006.detail: Fields with errors must be perceived by all users, regardless of their equipment.
testID-006.solution: Use the aria-invalid="true" attribute in the fields to indicate to assistive technology users that these fields are in error.

testID-007.title: Absence of error messages
testID-007.solution: Error messages allow users to easily detect input errors. Implement a form validation system to detect and display relevant and explicit error messages.

testID-007.title: Presence of non-explicit error messages
testID-007.detail: Error messages are not explicit enough to determine the nature of the error.
testID-007.solution: Explicit error messages allow users to easily detect and correct errors. Therefore, plan for a specific message depending on the nature of the error.

testID-007.title: Presence of error messages that do not identify the field in error
testID-007.detail: The text of the error messages does not allow identifying the field in error.
testID-007.solution: The text of the error message must allow identifying the field in error. The message must repeat the label of the field.

testID-008.title: Absence of correction suggestions
testID-008.detail:
When fields are in error, correction suggestions must be provided if necessary. For example:
 - Suggestion from a limited set of values
 - Additional help to correct an incorrectly formatted entry.
testID-008.solution: Provide appropriate correction suggestions for the field and the type of error made.

testID-077.title: Authentication has only a cognitive test
testID-077.detail: It is not possible to log in other than with a cognitive test.
testID-077.solution:
Another authentication technique must be present and not rely on a cognitive test, for example:
- email authentication
- login using OAuth
- fields are correctly labeled to allow automatic filling.

testID-009.title: Important data is submitted without the possibility of being canceled or verified
testID-009.detail: Users must have control when submitting important data (legal commitment, financial transaction, modification or deletion of important data, response to a test or exam…).
testID-009.solution:
Apply one of the solutions below:
 - The action can be canceled
 - a confirmation step allowing verification or modification is present before final validation.
testID-009.technicalSolution:
Example:
 After submitting the form, a confirmation message appears in a pop-up.
 The message repeats the data entered by the user and gives the option to validate or cancel.
 If the user cancels, they are redirected to the form, their entries are still present in the fields, with the possibility to modify them.

testID-010.title: Page title not provided
testID-010.detail: Each page must have a unique title.
testID-010.solution: Fill in the <title> element, with keywords that help understand the role of the page. Information can be ordered from the most specific to the least specific, or vice versa (no rules).

testID-010.title: Page title not relevant
testID-010.detail: Each page must have a unique title, allowing understanding of its role.
testID-010.solution: Fill in the <title> element with keywords that help understand the role of the page. Information can be ordered from the most specific to the least specific, or vice versa (no rules).

testID-076.title: Level titles are not relevant.
testID-076.detail:
Level titles must be relevant and accurately describe the section of content they present.
 Titles of the same level cannot have the same wording.

testID-013.title: Insufficient contrast between text and background
testID-013.detail: The contrast must be sufficient to understand the information conveyed by all texts.
testID-013.solution: Ensure a contrast of at least 4.5:1 for normal-sized texts (less than 24px CSS and 19px CSS in bold). Ensure a contrast of at least 3:1 for large-sized texts (greater than 24px CSS and 19px CSS in bold).

testID-013.title: Insufficient contrast for ununderlined links
testID-013.detail: Ununderlined links must have sufficient contrast with the surrounding text.
testID-013.solution: Ensure a contrast of at least 4.5:1 between an ununderlined link and the surrounding normal-sized text (less than 24px CSS and 19px CSS in bold). Ensure a contrast of at least 3:1 between an ununderlined link and the surrounding large-sized text (greater than 24px CSS and 19px CSS in bold).

testID-014.title: Insufficient contrast for icons conveying information
testID-014.detail: The contrast must be sufficient to convey the information.
testID-014.solution: Ensure a contrast of at least 3:1 for icons.

testID-014.title: Insufficient contrast for interactive components (buttons, radio buttons…)
testID-014.detail: The contrast must be sufficient to convey the information.
testID-014.solution: Ensure a contrast of at least 3:1 for the different states of interactive components.

testID-014.title: Insufficient contrast for states of interactive components (focus, hover, …)
testID-014.detail: The contrast must be sufficient to convey the information.
testID-014.solution: Ensure a contrast of at least 3:1 for the different states of interactive components.

testID-015.title: Color is the only means of conveying information
testID-015.detail: Color must not be the only means of conveying information: at least one other visual means is available to obtain the same information.
testID-015.solution: Complement the color with explicit text or another visual information (e.g., icons use colors but also different shapes).

testID-016.title: Sensory information is the only means of conveying information
testID-016.detail: Sensory information (e.g., position, size, sound) must not be the only means of transmitting information.
testID-016.solution: Complement the information with text or an explicit message.

testID-017.title: Truncated or hidden texts
testID-017.detail: Loss of information due to the presence of truncated or hidden texts when resizing the page (text zoom at 200%).
testID-017.solution: To resolve these issues, it is advisable to preferably use relative units (e.g., %, em, rem) for text, but also for the various parent containers (div, buttons...).

testID-017.title: Zoom is not allowed
testID-017.detail: Text enlargement must be possible on mobile.
testID-017.solution:
If a "<meta name='viewport'>" tag is present:
 - the user-scalable='no' parameter is not present
- and the maximum-scale parameter is not less than 2.

testID-018.title: Absence of ALT on images
testID-018.detail: All images must have an ALT attribute.
testID-018.solution: Add an ALT attribute to images.

testID-018.title: The ALT of a link image is not provided or not relevant
testID-018.detail: The content of the ALT attribute of each link image is not relevant to its link function.
testID-018.solution: Provide the target of the link in the ALT.

testID-018.title: The ALT of an informative image is not provided or not relevant
testID-018.detail: The ALT attribute of each image is not relevant to the role of the image on the page.
testID-018.solution: Provide in the ALT the information conveyed by the image.

testID-018.title: The ALT of an image containing text is not provided or not relevant
testID-018.detail: The ALT attribute must at least repeat the text of the image.
testID-018.solution: At a minimum, repeat the displayed text in the ALT.

testID-018.title: The ALT of a complex image (diagrams, graphs…) is not relevant
testID-018.solution: For any image description too long to be placed in an ALT attribute, the description of the image in HTML text is either present on the page or a link points to an HTML page containing the description, and this, near the image to be described.

testID-018.title: The aria-hidden attribute of a decorative SVG tag is not provided
testID-018.detail: A decorative SVG image must have an aria-hidden="true" attribute and a focusable="false" attribute.
testID-018.solution: Add the aria-hidden and focusable attributes to the SVG tag of the element.

testID-018.title: An informative SVG image has no textual alternative.
testID-018.detail: In the case of an SVG tag containing an informative image, the
testID-018.solution: Add either an alt attribute or a relevant aria-label attribute to the SVG tag.
testID-018.technicalSolution: Example of an tag with an image in .svg format For more information: https://a11y-guidelines.orange.com/fr/articles/svg-accessibles/

testID-019.title: Non-logical focus movement
testID-019.detail: The focus movement does not follow a logical reading order.

testID-019.title: Unintelligible reading order after CSS is disabled
testID-019.detail: The reading order must allow understanding and using the content when CSS is disabled on the page.
testID-019.solution: The order of appearance of elements in the HTML code must allow understanding and using the content of the page.

testID-020.title: Presence of ungrouped fields
testID-020.detail: When necessary, fields of the same nature must be grouped.
testID-020.solution:
- apply a "fieldset" completed by a "legend" element
- apply a "group" role on the parent element encapsulating the fields, and complete with an equivalent legend based on aria-labelledby

testID-021.title: Absence of list semantics
testID-021.detail: Elements visually presented as lists must be structured with list semantics.
testID-021.solution: Use appropriate list semantics <ul>, <ol> or <dl>, <dt> and <dd>

testID-023.title: Opening of a popup or modal when focusing on an element or loading the page
testID-023.detail: Upon loading the page or focusing, no modal or popup should open.

testID-023.title: Form submitted automatically without explicit user validation
testID-023.detail: A form is submitted automatically without user action.
testID-023.solution: A form must be submitted only after activating the submit button (onClick).

testID-023.title: Form submitted automatically upon changing parameters
testID-023.detail: A form is submitted automatically following the change of a checkbox state, a radio button, or a selection in a dropdown list...
testID-023.solution: A form must be submitted only after activating the submit button (onClick).

testID-023.title: Form submitted automatically upon data entry
testID-023.detail: A form is submitted automatically after entering data in a field (onInput).
testID-023.solution: A form must be submitted only after activating the submit button (onClick).

testID-049.title: Absence of ARIA roles (status, alert, alertdialog…) or dynamic aria-live regions
testID-049.detail: Alert messages are not perceived from a screen reader.
testID-049.solution:
Apply an ARIA role ("status", "alert", "alertdialog", etc…) or an "aria-live" attribute to the alert message so that it is vocalized automatically. Examples: -
[…]
-
[…]

testID-049.title: The progress of an action is not conveyed to the user
testID-049.detail: Progress via alert messages is not conveyed to the screen reader.
testID-049.solution:
Apply an ARIA role ("status", "alert", "alertdialog", etc…) or an "aria-live" attribute to the alert message so that it is vocalized automatically. Examples: -
[…]
-
[…]

testID-024.title: The state of a component is not perceived from a screen reader
testID-024.detail: Checked/unchecked, collapsed/expanded states are not perceived by a screen reader.
testID-024.solution:
- prioritize using native components (e.g., use input checkboxes for checkboxes, the state will be managed natively
 - otherwise, ensure to apply ARIA patterns to ensure correct semantics and state management of components (cf. attributes aria-expanded, aria-selected…)

testID-024.title: An interactive component is not usable with a screen reader
testID-024.detail: The functionalities of a component are not usable with a screen reader.
testID-024.solution:
- prioritize using native components (e.g., use input checkboxes for checkboxes, the state will be managed natively
- otherwise, ensure to apply ARIA patterns to ensure correct semantics.

testID-024.title: An interactive component has no accessible name
testID-024.detail: An interactive component has no accessible name.
testID-024.solution:
Prefer native methods by providing a button label.
 If necessary, the accessible name can be modified using ARIA attributes aria-label and aria-labelledby.

testID-025.title: Non-visible elements on the screen are conveyed by the screen reader
testID-025.detail: Non-visible elements on the screen are conveyed by the screen reader.

testID-026.title: The ALT of a decorative image is not relevant
testID-026.detail: The ALT attribute of a decorative image must be empty so that the image is ignored by assistive technologies.

testID-051.title: Absence of visible text on the screen in the accessible name
testID-051.detail: The text of the displayed label (the textual label or the text of the visible image on the screen) must be present (first, if possible) in the accessible name of this component.
testID-051.solution: Modify the accessible name of the element to include the visible text on the screen, if possible first.
testID-051.technicalSolution: Several solutions are possible to redefine the accessible name: aria-labelledby, aria-label, title, hidden accessible text.

testID-070.title: Absence of row or column header semantics
testID-070.detail: Headers are mandatory to identify the nature of the columns and/or rows.
testID-070.solution: Column header cells must have TH semantics + a scope="col" attribute. Row header cells must have TH semantics + a scope="row" attribute.

testID-070.title: Presence of a formatting table
testID-070.detail: Tables must not be used for formatting.
testID-070.solution: Add a role="presentation" to the table.

testID-058.title: Language change not indicated
testID-058.detail: Words and expressions in a foreign language must be indicated to users.
testID-058.solution: Add a lang attribute to the terms in a foreign language.

testID-059.title: Absence of level titles
testID-059.detail: There are missing level titles that would allow assistive technology users to directly access content on the page to avoid common elements (e.g., main navigation).
testID-059.solution: Use level titles (h1…) to define the different sections of your page.

testID-059.title: Absence of skip links
testID-059.detail: There are missing skip links that would allow direct access to content on the page to avoid common elements (e.g., main navigation).
testID-059.solution: Use skip links at the beginning of the page (first element of the <body>) to quickly access certain content on your page (main content, form…).

testID-059.title: Absence of tags to structure the page
testID-059.detail: There are missing structure tags (landmark) that would allow some users to better understand the page and skip content blocks to avoid common elements (e.g., main navigation).
testID-059.solution: Use structure tags to define the different sections of your page (header, nav, main, article…).

testID-027.title: Element not usable via keyboard
testID-027.detail: An element is not usable from keyboard navigation.

testID-028.title: Presence of keyboard traps on the page
testID-028.detail: Regardless of the type of component, the page or application, the user must be able to access all content via keyboard navigation without getting stuck.

testID-075.title: User has no control over a keyboard shortcut
testID-075.detail: The user has no control over a keyboard shortcut based on a character: letter (lowercase or uppercase), punctuation, number, or symbol character.
testID-075.solution:
The user must be able to:
 - disable the shortcut
 - or modify the shortcut to add an additional key to the combination
 - or ensure that the shortcut is active only when focusing on the interface component.

testID-029.title: Non-logical focus movement
testID-029.detail: The focus movement does not follow a logical reading order.

testID-030.title: Focus is displayed but poorly visible
testID-030.detail: The visibility of the focus must be sufficient (check contrast and size).
testID-030.solution:
To enhance the visibility of the focus, you can:
Provide sufficient contrast between the focus and the background color (minimum level 3.1).
Increase the size of the focus by modifying the CSS outline property (e.g., outline:2px).

testID-030.title: Focus visualization (outline) is disabled
testID-030.detail: The outline must not be disabled.
testID-030.solution: Check that the outline is not removed by a CSS property (e.g., outline:none;).

testID-030.title: Color alone allows visualization of focus
testID-030.detail: Color cannot be the only element distinguishing the focus.
testID-030.solution: Implement another means than color change for the focus indicator (e.g., shape, size, border, underline...).

testID-030.title: Focus visualization is insufficient
testID-030.detail: The contrast of the focus indicator must be sufficiently contrasted (3:1) compared to the background of the element.
testID-030.solution: Ensure a minimum contrast of 3:1 for different interactive components and the focus indicator.

testID-031.title: An action based on device movement or user gesture has no alternative
testID-031.detail: Any action based on device movement must have an alternative.
testID-031.solution: Allow triggering this action by another means (e.g., add a button in the interface).

testID-032.title: An action based on complex gestures has no alternative
testID-032.detail: Any action based on a complex gesture must have an alternative based on the use of a single pointer.
testID-032.solution: Example: for a zoom action on a map with a pinch gesture, an alternative in the form of a <button> [+] and [-] is provided.

testID-033.title: An action cannot be canceled
testID-033.detail: The action cannot be canceled as it is triggered on the DOWN event.
testID-033.solution:
- trigger the action on the UP event
 - for complex components (e.g., drag and drop), the action on UP is complemented by a dialog box giving users the option to cancel their action.

testID-034.title: Loss of information when viewing in portrait or landscape mode
testID-034.detail: Content and functionalities must be available in both orientations without loss of information.

testID-034.title: Content display is limited to a single orientation (landscape or portrait)
testID-034.detail: It is impossible to display content in both available orientations, or a message appears asking to reorient the device.

testID-035.title: Repeated components on multiple pages, in different orders
testID-035.detail: Repeated components on multiple pages do not appear in the same order on some pages.
testID-035.solution: The layout of components must be consistent across all pages of a site. Components must appear uniformly, in the same relative order.

testID-036.title: A time limit is not controllable by the user
testID-036.detail: Any time limit must be controllable by the user.
testID-036.solution: Any time limit must either be removed, or increased to at least 10 times the default time, or the user is warned at least 20 seconds before the end and can easily extend the duration.

testID-038.title: Opening of a popup or modal when focusing on an element or loading the page
testID-038.detail: Upon loading the page or focusing, no modal or popup should open.

testID-038.title: Form submitted automatically when focusing on an element
testID-038.detail: A form is submitted automatically as soon as an element of the form is focused (onFocus).
testID-038.solution: A form must be submitted only after activating the submit button (onClick).

testID-038.title: Content change occurs when focusing
testID-038.detail: A content change occurs without being voluntarily initiated by the user (onFocus).
testID-038.solution: A content change must occur only after voluntary triggering by the user (onClick) on a link or action button.

testID-038.title: Opening a new page when focusing
testID-038.detail: A page (or tab) change occurs without being voluntarily initiated by the user (onFocus).
testID-038.solution: A content change must occur only after voluntary triggering by the user (onClick) on a link.

testID-039.title: Absence of a mechanism to stop moving content
testID-039.detail: The user must have control over moving content.
testID-039.solution: Provide an accessible mechanism to stop or pause moving content.

testID-040.title: Presence of rapid flickering
testID-040.detail: Presence of content showing rapid flickering (more than 3 flashes per second) or flashes are below the general threshold or red threshold.

testID-056.title: Repeated components on multiple pages, with different labels
testID-056.detail: Repeated components on multiple pages do not have the same name (accessible).
testID-056.solution: Repeated components on multiple pages must have homogeneous labels.

testID-052.title: Presence of text in the form of an image
testID-052.detail: Texts must be present in the HTML and styled via CSS.
testID-052.solution: Integrate texts into the HTML and manage styling via CSS.

testID-054.title: Presence of link labels that are not understandable in their contexts
testID-054.detail: The target of a link is not understandable even with the help of its direct context (surrounding text).
testID-054.solution: Add discriminating information in the surrounding text.
testID-054.technicalSolution:
The solution depends on the context of use of the element: - element in a paragraph: complete the paragraph text (

[…]

) - element in a list: complete an item in the list (
    ,
      ) - element in a table cell: complete the text of the cell ([…]) or complete the direct header of the cell ([…]).

testID-068.title: Presence of button labels that are not understandable
testID-068.detail: The action conveyed by a button is not understandable.
testID-068.solution: Add discriminating information in the button labels.
testID-068.technicalSolution: The accessible name of the button must allow understanding its function; all or part of the text can be hidden in an accessible manner.

testID-069.title: Only one navigation mechanism is present
testID-069.detail: At least 2 navigation mechanisms must be present on the pages.
testID-069.solution:
Complete the existing mechanism with a solution listed below:
 - a main navigation menu
 - a table of contents
 - a sitemap
 - a search mechanism
 - a list of links allowing navigation throughout the site (footer).

testID-041.title: Absence of complete transcript
testID-041.detail: A complete transcript (text containing all visual and auditory information) must be provided as an alternative to audio or video tracks.
testID-041.solution: Add a complete transcript in HTML text, either directly on the page or via a link pointing to an HTML page containing this transcript, and this, near the element to be described.

testID-042.title: Absence of complete transcript
testID-042.detail: A complete transcript (text containing all visual and auditory information) must be provided as an alternative to audio or video tracks.
testID-042.solution: Add a complete transcript in HTML text, either directly on the page or via a link pointing to an HTML page containing this transcript, and this, near the element to be described.

testID-043.title: Absence of complete transcript
testID-043.detail: A complete transcript (text containing all visual and auditory information) must be provided as an alternative to audio or video tracks.
testID-043.solution: Add a complete transcript in HTML text, either directly on the page or via a link pointing to an HTML page containing this transcript, and this, near the element to be described.

testID-044.title: Absence of audio description
testID-044.detail: An audio description is necessary for videos presenting information visually.
testID-044.solution: Add an audio description in addition to the audio track if needed. This presents, in text format, the information conveyed solely by the image.

testID-045.title: Absence of subtitles
testID-045.detail: For any video, subtitles must be available.
testID-045.solution: Add subtitles in text format for all videos. These convey all information from the audio track.

testID-046.title: Absence of subtitles
testID-046.detail: For any video, subtitles must be available.
testID-046.solution: Add subtitles in text format for all videos. These convey all information from the audio track.

testID-047.title: Unable to stop an audio or video track
testID-047.detail: Audio tracks on the page that play automatically for more than 3 seconds can be stopped or paused.
testID-047.solution: Provide an easily reachable and accessible mechanism allowing users to stop or pause an audio (e.g., a link at the beginning of the tabbing 'pause the video').

testID-047.title: Unable to mute an audio or video track independently of system volume
testID-047.detail: Audio tracks on the page that play automatically for more than 3 seconds must provide a way to mute the sound, without being dependent on system volume.
testID-047.solution: Provide an easily reachable and accessible mechanism allowing users to control the volume of sounds played for more than 3 seconds (e.g., a link at the beginning of the tabbing 'mute the audio').

testID-065.title: Textual alternative of CAPTCHA absent or incorrect.
testID-065.detail: The textual alternative of the CAPTCHA image does not indicate to the user that it is a CAPTCHA.
testID-065.solution: Provide a valid textual alternative for this image, example: "CAPTCHA (anti-spam image)".

testID-066.title: Absence of alternative to CAPTCHA
testID-066.detail: Any purely visual or auditory CAPTCHA must have an accessible alternative.
testID-066.solution: Provide as an alternative: an audio + visual CAPTCHA, or logical tests (questions with obvious answers, simple math test…).
